title: Club Rules and Safety Guides
subtitle: Our principles for safe, respectful, and unforgettable adventures. Please read carefully before your first outing.
safety1_content: Each hiker must take responsibility for their own safety and that of the group: plan the activity well, equip everyone correctly, and act prudently. Carry maps, a compass (and/or GPS), and know the route, elevation gain, and risks. Inform someone of your route and expected return time. At any sign of fatigue or discomfort, stop, assess the situation, and if there are injuries or danger, turn back or call for help.
safety2_content:
Each participant must carry the “ten essentials” adapted to the Andalusian terrain:
- Navigation: Topographic map and compass; GPS optional.
- Illumination: Headlamp with spare batteries.
- Emergencies: Complete first-aid kit.
- Emergency shelter: Bivy sack or thermal blanket.
- Sun protection: Sunscreen SPF ≥30, sunglasses with UV filter, hat.
- Hydration and energy: Sufficient water (1–2 liters per person) and reserve food.
- Other useful items: Whistle, multi-tool knife, and lighter/waterproof matches.
- Appropriate clothing: Layered (thermal clothing, waterproof windbreaker) and sturdy hiking boots; avoid cotton.
safety3_content:
Always check the official weather forecast before heading out, especially in high mountains. Plan the route considering:
- Detailed route: Kilometers, elevation gain, water sources, shelters, and escape routes.
- Communications: Inform a family member or friend of your itinerary and return time. Carry a charged phone and/or emergency GPS devices.
- Safety apps: Use apps that send your location to rescue services in an emergency.
If there are bad weather alerts, postpone the outing until conditions are safe.

Follow the PAS protocol:
1. Protect: Signal dangers and avoid additional risks.
2. Alert: Call 112; provide your details, number of injured, type of injuries, and exact location.
3. Support: Apply basic first aid without moving serious fractures.
If you get lost, stay in a visible place, make signals with a whistle or light, and communicate your position if there is coverage.

Environmental Regulations and Ethics:
Our routes comply with Law 42/2007 on Natural Heritage and the specific regulations of Andalusia, including rules on camping, overnight stays, and fire according to each type of protected area.
lnt1_content: Plan to minimize waste and environmental impact.
lnt2_content: Travel and camp on durable surfaces. Do not disturb fauna or flora; respect other hikers.
lnt3_content: Do not litter: carry it with you to authorized containers.
lnt4_content: Minimize or avoid campfires; extinguish them completely if you make them. Respect signs, panels, and mountain furniture. Enjoy the environment without leaving a trace and preserve the mountains for future generations.
etiquette1_content: Be punctual, well-equipped, and keep pace with the group. Help comrades and share responsibilities.
etiquette2_content: Yield on narrow trails, keep your volume low, respect turns in shelters and rest areas. Clean up after yourself.
etiquette3_content: We welcome all people, regardless of gender, race, religion, or orientation. We promote cooperation, mutual support, and sustainable care for the environment.
